author: ja10
title: Impact Accelerator Rollout
description: Most accelerators do not factor purpose or impact as a driver of success, nor are they tuned to the specific needs of tech entrepreneurs.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal aims to run an incubator program for new startups and is targeting 20 devs to join the incubator. The project will help participants to define the path for the devs, discover their abilities , map out a vision and put together a plan for the vision. This aligns with the Challenge setting to increase the "Number of identified possible Challenges to be proposed in the following Funds based on proposals submitted in the Miscellaneous Challenge." This creates added value by steering new startup in the right direction and provides mentoring for the initial stages from experienced businessmen. The can scale linearly as requires a personal touch from the organizers.
f6_assessments.q1: The team backing the proposal are all businessmen with experience of starting businesses, which gives credibility that they will be able to teach newcomers something valuable. The linkedin profiles are not provided, but the 2 of the 4 that I verified leads to filled in linkedin pages with upwards of 500 connections each. The schedule is well documented and split by deliverables such as Project Management, Develop the program, Run the program. The budget is also split out by the same deliverables. The requested budget is 34k for a program that would develop a business blueprint for 20 developers, this is just under 2k per developer and just under 5k per for each of proposal members which are reasonable cost per dev and reasonable compensation. The proposal is a continuation of the MVP that was funded in Fund7 and targeted 10 developers. The proposal outlines the main risks as not attracting enough participant which I agree is the main risk. I did not find any information to backup the statement that the MVP was a success, nor feedback from participants, as well there is no mention of the material that will be used in the program, for this reason I do not give full marks.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is easy to audit as has a objective deliverable to "put in place a robust top-level, impactful, plan for achieving the vision of the devs". At the end, the devs that were part of the program come out with a plan, or not. Additional KPIs are listed and will be monitored on an ongoing basis such as the number of applications, number of those who finish and other linked to participation. A number of success metrics are listed and are based on the successful completion and max update of the program

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal is part of a project that has received funding in Fund 6-7. Proposer has provided the reason why this proposal appeared so that voters can better understand the project. In addition, how this project will affect Cardano and the Cardano developers as well as how this project will work has also been pointed out by the founding team. Proposer has also identified risks for this project, however, the solution to this risk should be made clearer..
f6_assessments.q1: Proposer has provided a quite detailed roadmap when it comes to specific activities in general elements. However, the information about the 'detailed budget breakdown' has a few places that need clarification, for example the costs incurred during project management, legal and HR handling and infrastructure should be broken down and a spending plan for each issue should be made for voters to clearly see the direction of the cash flow in this proposal. Likewise, although the proposer has provided the employee 'Guilherme Peirera' information via the linkedin link, the other team members still do not have any specific information. Proposer should add the missing profile.
f6_assessments.q2: Proposer has provided information related to KPIs so that voters can clearly see the measurement criteria for the progress and development of the project. This is a plus as the transparency of the project will be recognized even more. Likewise, KPIs for project success are also clearly indicated, which helps in clearly seeing the direction and goals of the founding team.

f6_assessments.q0:
To develop a ecosystem, it is necessary to involve many expertise in both technique and administration. The proposer already recognized about the insufficient roles of administration implementation besides mostly efforts are put in developing and strengthening system technically. So, the proposed solution was considered to address directly to challenges of high administrative load of the domain-expert team. On the other hand, the proposer can add more information about how internship students can support professional experts to reduce the load without any disturbance. In addition, the part of how it affect to both interns is necessary to add more, to make the solutions be more reliable. If having any case-studies relating to this matter, it is better to put here, to see the win-win condition clearer. 
There were 4 main KPIs with clear target of this proposal. It includes both quantitative and qualitative indicators so that it wil be clear for all people to think and follows. However, how to do them is also necessary to be included in the proposal. The proposer can think and provide more information about this part. 
According to the proposer, risk and challenges might be not exist here because this project is likely a sub project of the bigger program, where bigger risk might arise there and solve by bigger project. 
The project also have potentials to contribute to not only Cardano ecosystem but also outside Cardano client, as one of ways for economically successful service providers. It is such a nice idea by the proposer.
f6_assessments.q1:
As this is one of the sub-project of the overall huge project, information about human resources are available in the website provided, with core teams and experts utilization. However, it is necessary to share some intentions of the proposer about tentative members from that team will work and support for this project, matching their professions and the requirements of project. 
The roadmap for project was shortly mentioned by proposer. In this part, it is necessary to add information on what they tend to do in a period, with specific timing and duration. In addition, the propose need to clarify how they are going to realize that timeline in reality. Therefore, it is necessary for the proposer to include these detailed information. 
In the proposal, it was mentioned that, the budget is just only for 6 months of direct implementation. The proposer can consider to add more detailed payment to be align with the timeline to let all people understand thoroughly about its benefits.
f6_assessments.q2:
As the project is quite simple, the KPIs and key metrics is allocated in such a detailed indicators with both quantity and quality. It will helps all audiences and readers understand about this project target and having common understanding. 
The ending picture is clearly described that, aligning with the goals, the internship person, the professional team and assignment could be completed with a clear target. 
Through the proposal, it was recognized that, as the project is a part of bigger project, which seemed to be a continuation of a previous funded project in Catalyst. Therefore, the proposer already put others proposals belong to common project as evidences for it.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is well suited to the miscellaneous challenge, as it is a continuation of a F7 challenge that is not included in F8. The problem statement and solution are clear, to fill the need for tech focused, and purpose driven, startups. 
The success of this program can provide significant value to the cardano ecosystem, by providing coaching and training to key players such as stake pool operators and other startups. This can help various businesses to thrive within the Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The team and background are provided in this proposal, and they have extensive experience in business coaching and start up mentoring. The budget is broken down and clearly linked to milestones, timelines and hourly compensation. The project roadmap is included with a link to miro board that provides a clear visual overview of the roadmap. The budget is reasonable, and while some items are billed at $500 per hr, I believe the experience of the team and their qualifications justify this cost and value provided.
f6_assessments.q2:
This proposal includes a detailed roadmap and budget, however it is missing a crucial element, the timeline, or deadline for when the team expects this work to be completed. Without even an estimate for when the community can expect to see this course completed, it is difficult to audit the success of the funded proposal or track progress. Additionally, they have not provided any details on the current progress or success of their previously funded proposal. It would be good to know how the team has progressed since the last funding round where they received $35000 to begin working on this accelerator program. For this reason I have given 3 stars. 
Below are the provided key metrics and success indicators;

"Key Metrics: 

Number of developers engaged in marketing 
Number of applications received 
Number of successful applications 
Number of participants starting the programme 
Number of participants completing the programme 
Number of Alumni from MVP engaged with new Cohort 
 
These metrics will be measured on an ongoing basis throughout the project and will then we summarised in the end of project report, along with end of project debriefs with participants. 

Similarly, we will be running weekly project management meetings to assess progress against the milestone plan, alongside regular Catalyst meetings with coordinators to update on progress and where support might be necessary. 

What does success for this project look like?
Success indicators: 

Max Cohort (20) 
Successful completion of accelerator by developers 
Successful business audits completed 
Successful vision and business plans completed 
Engagement by Alumni from MVP in some capacity 
Completed research report covering metrics and feedback from participants, as well as opportunities and challenges for future funds. "

f6_assessments.q0: The "Accelerators and Mentors" was one of the most interesting challenges in fund7 and I personally was surprised to not see the same in fund8. Along with all the community hubs out there to draw more minds into the network, the accelerators were equally important if not more to provide the developers with proper guidance and make sure the projects were as impactful as they were promised during the submission stage. The proposer here intends to spread its wings and reach more users and embed good business practices into the developer community. The repercussions of this MVP are huge considering the quality and reach of the Cardano Community. The proposal intends to report the outcomes and identify the possible challenges that can be set for the following funds thus aiding the community with identifying the issues out there in the ecosystem and making sure they are tended to at the earliest. The proposer is also aware of the risk of not reaching enough end-users and seems to have the essential tools in his pocket to mitigate it, which shows the intent the team carries.
f6_assessments.q1: With the well-narrated action plan and reasonable deliverables, the chances of the proposal being successful are very high. The team has already developed an MVP that was funded during the last round, which shows the passion the team carries around. The team members introduced are heavyweights in their fields and come with a lot of experience. The names put out there with their expertise almost fill in every shoe the team thinks is required to pull this off. Since the proposal is more of an engagement phase rather than a development phase, the feasibility metrics can be a little more simple to evaluate, as a working MVP is already available to go forward with. The requested funds being less than 10% of the total challenge funds seems reasonable and the proposer provides the readers with a proper division of how and to whom the funds are distributed. With an hourly work plan and a detailed infographic project roadmap, it shows the community that an extensive amount of groundwork has already been done and the chances of successful implementation are very likely.
f6_assessments.q2: Taking into consideration the well-defined roadmap, the KPIs are very much aligned to the milestones set by the team. The number of engagements, number of participants, number of returning Alumni are all verifiable and quantifiable metrics. This being a miscellaneous challenge, there lies no standard benchmark to compare the metrics to. However, the success criteria the team has defined for themselves look just about right and could be good enough to assist the auditing process to make it prolific. The team has already raised funds and successfully delivered the proposed project, which would in no doubt provide all assistance the community needs to track their progress. However, coming into the funding with prior experience, I personally would had loved to see some numbers thrown against the mentioned KPIs beforehand so as to show the confidence the team has in their proposal, and then comparing the progress would have been more undemanding for the auditors

solution: Implement our purpose led accelerator MVP developed in F7 with a wider pool of developers.
experience:
As Impact focused experts we run high growth coaching & mentoring programmes from tech startups, through to Global businesses & Universities. 
 
This is a continuation of our MVP for the F7 Accelerators and Mentors challenge, in our Impact Innovation Accelerator project.
